Overview of Cape Peninsula University of Technology – CPUT

CPUT stands for Cape Peninsula University of Technology, which is a university of technology located in Cape Town, South Africa. It was established in January 2005 as a result of the merger between two former institutions, the Cape Technikon and Peninsula Technikon. CPUT offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs in various fields such as engineering, business, science, health, and arts and design. The university has six faculties and several campuses located in different parts of Cape Town.

About the Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) Postgraduate Application 2024

This is to inform all and sundry that the management of the Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) is inviting applications from interested and suitably qualified students (Indigents and International) for admission into Postgraduate programmes for the 2024 academic year.

Before you apply, see they know the actual programs (Course) available for the 2024 Postgraduateadmission.

Cape Peninsula University of Technology Courses

Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate courses across six faculties. Here are some of the popular courses offered by CPUT:

  • Faculty of Applied Sciences: Biotechnology, Chemistry, Food Technology, Horticulture, Marine Science, and Sports Science.
  • Faculty of Business and Management Sciences: Accounting, Business Administration, Entrepreneurship, Human Resource Management, Marketing, and Tourism Management.
  • Faculty of Education: Foundation Phase Teaching, Intermediate Phase Teaching, Senior Phase and FET Teaching, Educational Psychology, and Curriculum Studies.
  • Faculty of Engineering and the Built Environment: Chemical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, and Town and Regional Planning.
  • Faculty of Health and Wellness Sciences: Dental Sciences, Emergency Medical Care, Medical Laboratory Science, Nursing, Occupational Therapy, Pharmacy, Physiotherapy, and Radiography.
  • Faculty of Informatics and Design: Applied Design, Architectural Technology, Computer Science, Graphic Design, Information Technology, Interior Design, Multimedia, and Public Relations Management.

CPUT Postgraduate Requirements

The admission requirements for postgraduate studies at Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) may vary depending on the specific program and faculty. However, in general, the following are the minimum requirements for admission to a postgraduate program at CPUT:

A relevant undergraduate qualification:

Applicants should have a relevant undergraduate degree or diploma from a recognized institution.

Minimum academic performance:

Applicants should have achieved a minimum average of 60% in their undergraduate degree or diploma.

English language proficiency:

Applicants whose first language is not English must provide proof of proficiency in English, such as a TOEFL or IELTS score.

Additional requirements:

Some postgraduate programs may have additional requirements, such as work experience or specific prerequisite courses.

Research proposal:

Applicants for research-based postgraduate programs, such as a master’s degree or PhD, are required to submit a research proposal outlining the intended research project.

7 Steps to Purchase CPUT Online Application

Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) allows applicants to apply for admission to its courses through an online application system. Here are the steps to follow for the CPUT online application process:

Step 1

  • Visit the CPUT website: Go to the official website of CPUT at www.cput.ac.za.

Step 2

  • Create an account: Click on the “Apply” button and create an account by entering your personal details and a valid email address.

Step 3

  • Login: Once you have created an account, login to the online application portal using your login details.

Step 4

  • Select a course: Choose the course you want to apply for and make sure you meet the minimum admission requirements.

Step 5

  • Upload documents: Upload all the required documents, such as your academic transcripts, ID or passport, and proof of payment for the application fee.

Step 6

  • Submit application: After completing the application form and uploading all the required documents, submit your application.

Step 7

  • Track application status: Check your email regularly to receive updates on your application status. You can also track your application status by logging in to the online application portal.

CPUT Login

To login to your Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) account, follow these steps:

  • Visit the official CPUT website at www.cput.ac.za
  • Click on the “Login” button on the top right-hand corner of the page.
  • Enter your username and password in the appropriate fields.
  • Click on the “Login” button to access your account.

Once you have logged in, you will be able to access various features such as student services, course registration, academic records, and more. If you have forgotten your username or password, you can use the “Forgot Username” or “Forgot Password” links on the login page to recover your account information. Alternatively, you can contact the CPUT IT Helpdesk for assistance.

CPUT Login Reset Password

if you have forgotten your Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) login password, you can follow these steps to reset it:
  • Go to the CPUT website at www.cput.ac.za.
  • Click on the “Login” button on the top right-hand corner of the page.
  • Click on the “Forgot Password” link.
  • Enter your email address or student number and click on “Reset Password.”
  • Check your email for a link to reset your password.
  • Follow the instructions in the email to reset your password.

If you have any issues with resetting your password or accessing your account, you can contact the CPUT IT Helpdesk for assistance.

CPUT Application Fees Payment

To pay the Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) application fee, you can follow these steps:
  • Visit the CPUT website at www.cput.ac.za and navigate to the “Apply” section.
  • Select the appropriate application form for your level of study and complete the application form.
  • When you reach the payment section of the application, select the payment method of your choice.
  • If you choose to pay online using a credit or debit card, you will be directed to a secure payment gateway to enter your payment details.
  • Alternatively, if you choose to pay in person at a CPUT campus, you can print out your application form and take it with you to make the payment using cash or a bank guaranteed cheque.
  • After completing the payment, you will receive a confirmation of payment which you should keep as proof of payment.

Documents Required for CPUT Online Application 2024

  • A valid NBT Academic Literacy Test Plus report with an overall score of Upper Intermediate or above.
  • A TOEFL iBT Score Report with an overall score of 88 or above, with at least 19 in Listening, 19 in Writing, 20 in Reading, and 22 in Speaking.
  • A valid IELTS Academic Test Report Form with an overall score of band 6.5 or above, with at least 6.0 in each component.
  • A valid PTE Academic Score Report with an overall score of 67 or above, with at least 59 in each communicative skills component.

CPUT Application Status

To check your Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) application status, you can follow these steps:

  • Go to the CPUT website at www.cput.ac.za.
  • Click on the “Student” tab on the top right-hand corner of the page.
  • Select “Student Self-Service” from the dropdown menu.
  • Log in to your account using your CPUT student number and password.
  • Once logged in, select “Admission” from the menu on the left-hand side of the page.
  • Select “View Application Status” to see the current status of your application.

If your application has been successful, you should receive an official admission letter from CPUT. If your application has been unsuccessful, you will also receive communication from the university indicating the reason for the rejection.

CPUT Application is rejected, what next

If your Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) application is rejected, there are several options you can consider:

Request feedback:

You can request feedback from the university to understand why your application was rejected. This can help you identify areas for improvement and make changes to your application before reapplying in the future.

Reapply:

You can choose to reapply for the same program or a different program at CPUT. Before reapplying, it is important to carefully review the admission requirements and ensure that your application is complete and meets all the necessary criteria.

Consider other options:

If you are not accepted into CPUT, you can consider other universities or institutions that offer similar programs. Research and compare programs at other universities to find one that is a good fit for your goals and qualifications.

Seek advice:

You can seek advice from a career counselor or education consultant who can help you explore other options and provide guidance on how to improve your application.

CPUT SOS

Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) offers a Student Support and Development (SSD) service, which includes an SOS (Student Crisis and Support) service. The SOS service provides students with support during times of crisis, including emotional, academic, financial, and health-related concerns.

If you are in need of urgent assistance, you can contact the CPUT SOS service as follows:

  • Call the emergency number: 021 959 6550 (24-hour emergency line)
  • Call the student crisis line: 0800 222 316 (toll-free from any Telkom line)
  • Visit the student health and wellness center on your campus
  • Email sos@cput.ac.za

CPUT Email

The email address for Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) is info@cput.ac.za. This email address can be used to contact the university with general inquiries, questions, or feedback.
